Please ensure your unit coordinators and faculty staff are briefed. A system message will appear in the travel portal beginning 30 October. 
Sincerely, 
Dr. Lars Wiegand 
Head of Process Compliance Subject: Enforced Metadata Validation for Travel Permit Submissions 
From: Finance and Compliance Coordination Office 
Date: 17 October 2017 
To: All Budget Owners, Project Leads, Travel Officers 
Category: Process Enforcement 
 
Dear Colleagues, 
In preparation for the annual financial reconciliation and internal audit season, we are implementing a mandatory data validation protocol on all travel permit submissions, effective 1 November 2017. 
 
Policy Update 
All submitted travel permits must now contain: 
• A valid budget number 
• A specified project number and task ID 
• A populated activity code (if applicable) 
Permits lacking these fields will be automatically flagged for pre-approval review and may be returned to the requester. 
 
Compliance Context 
This update aligns with Article 9 of the University Financial Control Framework and addresses audit concerns regarding: 
• Budget mismatches 
• Duplicate trip registrations 
• “Unknown” fields in travel cost tracking reports

6597534475f57ef946f9231918a83612.evidence_snippet: New Approval Structure (Effective 2 January 2018) 1. Employee Submits Request 2. 60df07fd14e5c030d269c1abe2c87491.cause_description: This could suggest that the introduction of the Erasmus+ 2018 mobility call, with its expanded travel budget limits and eligibility for research-linked exchanges, represents a series of small adjustments in the mobility process. These incremental changes may have been implemented to enhance faculty and staff exchanges, reflecting an ongoing effort to improve the mobility framework over time.
60df07fd14e5c030d269c1abe2c87491.evidence_snippet: Subject: New Call: Erasmus+ Mobility Projects (2018 Intake) From: International Funding Desk To: Faculty Mobility Coordinators, Project Officers Date: 14 December 2017 Dear Partners, The Erasmus+ 2018 mobility call for faculty and staff exchanges is now open. Application documents and templates have been released by the EU Commission. Key features: • Expanded travel budget limits (up to €1,100 per mobility slot) • Eligibility for research-linked exchanges (min. 5 days) • New regions: Baltic + Western Balkans now supported Deadlines: • Internal pre-check: 12 January • Submission to EU Portal: 25 January Please notify us by 22 December if your unit plans to submit. Sincerely, Amira Cenk Senior Mobility Coordinator

f8c96954b0ff8b36e27c28127f24265a.evidence_snippet: New Approval Structure (Effective 2 January 2018) 1. Employee Submits Request 2. Review by Pre-Approver o Must be a designated financial reviewer within the unit o Verifies metadata and eligibility 3. Final Approval by Supervisor 4. System Payment Trigger This new step applies to all projects, including internal cost centers and third-party funded activities.

d9373fece048d7e99a623d3a87948ad7.cause_description: The evidence may indicate that the introduction of the digital parking management system in November 2017 represents an incremental change in the organization's operational processes. This pilot program, which replaces physical dashboard passes with a digital permit request system, suggests a series of small adjustments aimed at improving efficiency and user experience. The iterative feedback mechanism mentioned in the communication could lead to further refinements and enhancements over time, aligning with agile BPM practices.
d9373fece048d7e99a623d3a87948ad7.evidence_snippet:
Subject: Pilot Launch of Digital Parking Management System 
From: Campus Infrastructure & Logistics 
To: All Employees – Urban Campus 
Date: 15 November 2017 
Category: Operational Update 
 
Dear Team, 
We are launching a 3-month pilot of a new digital parking registration system for staff vehicle 
access at the Urban Campus. 
 
Key Pilot Details 
• Digital permit request replaces physical dashboard passes 
• License plate number will be used for gate recognition 
• Limited spaces will rotate on a reservation basis 
• Staff will receive access based on declared office presence 
 
Your participation and feedback will help us determine whether to expand the system across all 
sites in early 2018. 
Thank you for your support, 
Manuel Dietrich 
Logistics Systems Manager

252a573a8ddc22d4afcafbb8c0d916de.cause_description: The evidence may indicate that the implementation of mandatory metadata checks for prepaid travel cost requests represents a series of incremental adjustments aimed at improving data accuracy and compliance. This gradual shift towards more stringent validation protocols could reflect an ongoing effort to address recurring audit findings and enhance the overall efficiency of the travel cost system. Such iterative improvements align with agile BPM practices, where small, continuous changes accumulate to create significant process transformation.
252a573a8ddc22d4afcafbb8c0d916de.evidence_snippet: Starting 2 July 2018, the travel cost system will enforce automated pre-checks before allowing a Request for Payment to proceed. Specifically: • Valid permit IDs must be attached for all international travel • Budget and project numbers must match those recorded in the permit • Incomplete or “UNKNOWN” entries will block submission

178358be700ed7f78bdcf94892c33e60.cause_description: This could suggest that the organization is implementing a series of small, iterative changes to its absence reporting processes, as indicated by the transition to an upgraded Workforce Presence Platform. The introduction of a centralized entry for various types of leave and the daily synchronization with finance may represent incremental improvements aimed at enhancing efficiency and user experience over time.
178358be700ed7f78bdcf94892c33e60.evidence_snippet:
Subject: Launch of Updated Absence Logging System 
From: Human Resources 
To: Department Admins and Timekeepers 
Date: 8 November 2017 
 
Dear Colleagues, 
As part of the transition to our upgraded Workforce Presence Platform, all units are required to 
begin using the new absence reporting module starting 15 November. 
 
     What’s changing: 
• Centralized entry for travel, sick leave, and remote work 
• Daily sync with finance to match per-diem and trip status 
• Access via staff portal (no VPN needed) 
 
An onboarding webinar will take place 13 November, 10:00–10:45. No registration needed. 
Best regards, 
Olga Baumgartner 
HR Process Innovation

     What’s changing: 
2 Centralized entry for travel, sick leave, and remote work 
2 Daily sync with finance to match per-diem and trip status 
2 Access via staff portal (no VPN needed) 
 
An onboarding webinar will take place 13 November, 10:00:45. No registration needed. 
Best regards, 
Olga Baumgartner 
HR Process Innovation

3028e317e68f3fa782a8912e1762fd52.evidence_snippet:
Subject: Revised Deadlines for Year-End Project Funding Allocations 
From: Research Funding Office 
To: Project PIs, Department Finance Officers 
Date: 21 December 2017 
 
Dear Colleagues, 
Please note the following changes to year-end cost allocation windows for 2017-funded 
projects: 
 
What’s Changing 
• Transfer requests must be submitted by 28 December 17:00 
• Unspent travel funds will not roll over unless pre-declared 
• Supplemental requests for mobility grants will not be accepted after 5 January 
These changes align with adjustments in funding structures by the Joint Academic Research Board. 
For assistance, contact: research-finance@university.edu 
Best regards, 
Magdalena Stroh 
Grant Funding Coordinator

84b20e71bfc05e6bfe5aaf10ac8bf796.evidence_snippet:
Subject: Scheduled Downtime: Finance Portal Upgrade 
From: IT Operations + Financial Systems 
To: All Users of Reimbursement & Claim Portals 
Date: 4 January 2018 
 
Dear Users, 
Please be advised that the Finance Portal will be unavailable from 5 January (18:00) until 7 
January (12:00) for scheduled upgrades. 
 
This affects: 
• Travel declaration uploads 
• Request for Payment submissions 
• Budget tracking dashboards 
 
No data will be lost. Queued submissions will resume automatically once the upgrade is 
complete. 
     Need help? Contact portal-support@university.edu 
Thank you, 
Luis Rettig 
Systems Reliability Lead

2eb8b83bf3ef48f15793bec3f2055afa.cause_description: This could suggest that the sudden drift in processes on January 8, 2018, was triggered by the impending deadline for staff card re-issuance, as outlined in the communication from University Card Services. Thank you, Tamara Hesse Service Access & ID Office

classifications.reasoning: The text discusses an IT security audit which is part of compliance efforts, indicating a focus on IT management and system security.
The mention of ISO 27001 compliance indicates adherence to external legal and regulatory standards.

513b258a7c2c273d71ff99c28ae7d0a6.cause_description: This could suggest that the organization was engaged in a series of small, iterative improvements to its IT security processes, as indicated by the scheduled IT security audit. The audit's focus on various aspects such as local device encryption, access log sampling, and password policy adherence may reflect ongoing adjustments aimed at enhancing compliance and security measures over time.
513b258a7c2c273d71ff99c28ae7d0a6.evidence_snippet: Subject: Scheduled IT Security Audit – October–November 2017 From: Information Security Office To: All Staff and System Owners Date: 27 October 2017 Category: Compliance Notice Dear Colleagues, As part of our recurring internal controls program, the Information Security Office will conduct a university-wide IT audit from 30 October to 17 November. This effort supports our ISO 27001 compliance efforts. What to Expect • Review of local device encryption • Access log sampling in core systems • Password policy adherence checks • Random interviews with departmental IT reps Departments will be contacted at least 3 days in advance of site visits. We ask for your cooperation to ensure a smooth and efficient audit process. Thank you, Tobias Mahler Chief Information Security Officer

• Duplicate trip registrations 
• “Unknown” fields in travel cost tracking reports 

Please ensure your unit coordinators and faculty staff are briefed. A system message will appear 
in the travel portal beginning 30 October. 
Sincerely, 
Dr. Lars Wiegand 
Head of Process Compliance Subject: Enforced Metadata Validation for Travel Permit Submissions 
From: Finance and Compliance Coordination Office 
Date: 17 October 2017 
To: All Budget Owners, Project Leads, Travel Officers 
Category: Process Enforcement 
 
Dear Colleagues, 
In preparation for the annual financial reconciliation and internal audit season, we are 
implementing a mandatory data validation protocol on all travel permit submissions, 
effective 1 November 2017. 
 
Policy Update 
All submitted travel permits must now contain: 
• A valid budget number 
• A specified project number and task ID 
• A populated activity code (if applicable) 
Permits lacking these fields will be automatically flagged for pre-approval review and may be 
returned to the requester. 
 
Compliance Context 
This update aligns with Article 9 of the University Financial Control Framework and addresses 
auditing concerns regarding: 
• Budget mismatches 
• Duplicate trip registrations 
• “Unknown” fields in travel cost tracking reports

This effort supports our ISO 27001 compliance efforts. What to Expect • Review of local device encryption • Access log sampling in core systems • Password policy adherence checks • Random interviews with departmental IT reps Departments will be contacted at least 3 days in advance of site visits. We ask for your cooperation to ensure a smooth and efficient audit process. Thank you, Tobias Mahler Chief Information Security Officer
